name: Spark Gap
description: Draw wire paths to connect sparking terminals before the charge drains, routing electricity through a cluttered circuit board while avoiding shorts that blow your fuses.
core_loop: A charge builds at a glowing terminal â€” drag to draw a wire path through the board to reach the target terminal before the energy bar depletes. Obstacles like capacitors, resistors, and live wires block your route; crossing another wire causes a short that blows one of your three fuses. Each completed connection powers up a section of the board, revealing new terminal pairs at faster drain rates. Longer paths score more but risk running out of charge. Every few connections trigger a 'surge round' where multiple pairs must be linked simultaneously under a shared timer.
retention_hooks: Board progressively lights up as you complete connections â€” satisfying visual payoff of powering a whole circuit
Surge rounds create escalating panic moments that feel like clutch plays when you nail them
High score chasing with combo multipliers for consecutive clean connections (no shorts)
controls: Touch/mouse drag to draw wire paths from source terminal to target terminal. Tap a drawn wire to erase it and reroute. That's it â€” one finger, one action.
